body:
For the record, one anti-semite who would not stop trying to get me to agree to some trivial fact or other so he could lead me into an eventual "the jooooos run everything" trap, no matter how much I mocked him, and two individuals who could not handle the fact that I would not agree that their straw men were the same as my positions, and became abusive about it.

It's pretty simple, really. If you ascribe opinions to me that are not mine, and do not back off and apologize when I correct you, I'm going to treat you like a lying sack of shit and then prevent you from wasting my time further. Disagreement is fine. Pretending you can read my mind and tell me what I really think and mean is not.
body_html:
For the record, one anti-semite who would not stop trying to get me to agree to some trivial fact or other so he could lead me into an eventual "the jooooos run everything" trap, no matter how much I mocked him, and two individuals who could not handle the fact that I would not agree that their straw men were the same as my positions, and became abusive about it.

It's pretty simple, really. If you ascribe opinions to me that are not mine, and do not back off and apologize when I correct you, I'm going to treat you like a lying sack of shit and then prevent you from wasting my time further. Disagreement is fine. Pretending you can read my mind and tell me what I really think and mean is not.

body:
That's an interesting read on it.

In what way is a Randian libertarian a "leftist", out of curiosity?

My issues were that he posted a graph, it, at best, very weakly supported his commentary, and that his commentary was an attempt to bootstrap from "here's an odd correlation" to "rich people baaaaaad", which nothing he said or linked got him anywhere close to. I gave him a chance to illuminate me, told him two ways he could argue it belonged in that guild, and he basically said "nuh uh". So I kicked it. Then he called me names, because he didn't like that. 

He didn't like that, and I guess you don't either. Well, nobody's forcing you to join that guild, and if you love his post, you can start your own guild and yank it in.

You misundersood him. He said that wealth was a good thing as it correlates with health. That's consistent with your Randian view. You then asked him to prove it. While it's possible to support such a position with evidence, and he did, you asked him to prove it, which is not possible, and he said as much. Basically you threatened to remove his submission from your guild unless he meets an impossibly high standard. That's a chickenshit way to abuse your power and is reminiscent of how reddit is run. 

The left and right are a way of seeing and interacting with the world, more fundamental than the political and economic views that stem from them. You may believe in free market capitalism but your actions in that exchange are not consistent with Randian principles.

He didn't like that, and I guess you don't either. Well, nobody's forcing you to join that guild, and if you love his post, you can start your own guild and yank it in.

body:
If that's what he intended to say, he said it very badly, and failed completely to express it. Then he started calling me names, instead of clarifying. Which, in its own way, is clarifying in and of itself, particularly when he kept coming back to insult me more.

As to an impossibly high standard, I did not ask him to prove it to a thousand percent accuracy, I was asking him to show me that the graph he had posted was as relevant to the guild as he seemed to think, and told him two metrics on which he might do so. There was no standard of perfection, in any way.

> ...your actions are not consistent with Randian principles.

I gave him a chance to convince me. I explained multiple ways in which he might do so. I listened to what he said, and judged it wanting. He abused me for not doing what he wanted, and I put up with that abuse only to a certain point, then I blocked him because he was wasting time out of my life.

Where, precisely, did I violate "Randian principles"? And which principles were they?

You misundersood him. He said that wealth was a good thing as it correlates with health. That's consistent with your Randian view. You then asked him to prove it. While it's possible to support such a position with evidence, and he did, you asked him to prove it, which is not possible, and he said as much. Basically you threatened to remove his submission from your guild unless he meets an impossibly high standard. That's a chickenshit way to abuse your power and is reminiscent of how reddit is run. 

The left and right are a way of seeing and interacting with the world, more fundamental than the political and economic views that stem from them. You may believe in free market capitalism but your actions in that exchange are not consistent with Randian principles.

post.title: Are you using your block option here?

body:
No. Blocking someone here means that they can't reply to my submissions or comments. I'm not about that censorship.

I have recently begun blocking people on Reddit. Over there, it works more like a global ignore button. The user can still reply to my submissions or comments, but I don't see theirs as long as I'm logged in. Reddit's block feature is meant to prevent harassment, but I think Ruqqus's implementation is better for there. Where I think Reddit's block function is really useful is for filtering out content from idiots, which is useful, because there are a lot of them there. Reddit doesn't exactly make it easy to block people, but I have managed to filter out some of the regular users on subreddits I frequent, and I feel like my experience is improved as a result.

It might be nice to have such a global ignore function here, but it would be low on my list of requests.

parent.body:
If that's what he intended to say, he said it very badly, and failed completely to express it. Then he started calling me names, instead of clarifying. Which, in its own way, is clarifying in and of itself, particularly when he kept coming back to insult me more.

As to an impossibly high standard, I did not ask him to prove it to a thousand percent accuracy, I was asking him to show me that the graph he had posted was as relevant to the guild as he seemed to think, and told him two metrics on which he might do so. There was no standard of perfection, in any way.

> ...your actions are not consistent with Randian principles.

I gave him a chance to convince me. I explained multiple ways in which he might do so. I listened to what he said, and judged it wanting. He abused me for not doing what he wanted, and I put up with that abuse only to a certain point, then I blocked him because he was wasting time out of my life.

Where, precisely, did I violate "Randian principles"? And which principles were they?

There was no standard of perfection, in any way.
